thread.title: Arsenal eyeing summer swoop for Monaco's Tiemou Bakayoko? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers
thread.title_full: Arsenal eyeing summer swoop for Monaco's Tiemou Bakayoko? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers

author: Football Spy
title: Arsenal eyeing summer swoop for Monaco's Tiemou Bakayoko? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers
text:
Arsenal eyeing summer swoop for Monaco's Tiemou Bakayoko? Transfer news and gossip from Friday's papers PLUS: Pep Guardiola fancies bringing Inter Milan's goalkeeper Samir Handanovic to Manchester City Share Sergio Aguero and Tiemoue Bakayok during Manchester City's 5-3 Champions League Last 16 first-leg win against Monaco (Photo: PA) Share Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Arsenal are reportedly sweet on Monaco's hotly-rated 22-year-old Tiemoue Bakayoko. 
The Â£40 million-rated midfielder has been at the heart of the club's resurgence this season and did his reputation no harm in the 5-3 Etihad Epic against Manchester City on Tuesday. 
He's turning heads of Europe's biggest clubs, with Chelsea, Manchester United and Paris Saint-Germain among those said to be keeping tabs on his progress . 
But the Daily Star reports that Arsenal have now joned the race to sign the player, who is under contract until 2019. 
The Gunners are keen to bolster their midfield options, with Santi Cazorla a huge injury doubt for the future , Jack Wilshere in the final year of his contract and Aaron Ramsey struggling for form. Arsenal are light in midfield due to Santi Cazorla's ongoing injury issues (Photo: David Price) Read More Stories from other newspapers and websites 
Pep Guardiola wants to bring Inter Milan's goalkeeper Samir Handanoiv to the Etihad (The Sun) 
Newcastle's Aleksandar Mitrovic is a shock target for French champions PSG (Daily Star) 
Chelsea boss Antonio Conte wanted talented Inter winger Jonathan Biabiany in January (Daily Telegraph) Inter's Samir Handanovic is turning heads at the Etihad (Photo: Getty Images) Transfer stories from Friday's Daily Mirror 
EXCLUSIVE: Leicester sacked Claudio Ranieri after their title-winning squad complained to the board . The Foxes players had lost faith and patience with the Italian after changing a number of things from last season. 
Gary Lineker has slammed Leicester over their decision to sack Ranieri - "Inexplicable, unforgivable and gut-wrenchingly sad". 
Throwing scissors, sulking and scoring screamers - Zlatan Ibrahimovic from the people who REALLY know him . Ranieri's sacking dominates the Friday papers (Photo: Shaun Botterill) poll loading Will Tiemou Bakayoko end up in the Premier League? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
